comments.body:
I think (but haven't tested) that if self._task is a TaskInclude, then if used in conjunction with https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/37304, this could be:

``` python
def __eq__(self, other):
    return other._filename == self._filename and other._args == self._args and other._task._parent == self._task._parent
```

Possibly even 
``` python
def __eq__(self, other):
    return other._filename == self._filename and other._args == self._args and other._task == self._task
```

But, untested...
Looks good, shipit. It seems like you eliminated the file not found errors by fixing the search paths. Is there a case where this sentence suggesting that it still may be the problem is needed?
To be honest I am not sure, but since we just swallowed the error before, I figured it would be a good idea to at least report any potential error here.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +131,135 @@                                            display.warning(
                                                'Templating the path of the parent %s failed. The path to the '
                                                'included file may not be found. '
                                                'The error was: %s.' % (original_task.action, to_text(e))
                                            )
